info.bobkirby.valve
Class JDBCAccessLogFilter.FilterResponse

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.ServletResponseWrapper
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseWrapper
          info.bobkirby.valve.JDBCAccessLogFilter.FilterResponse
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.ServletResponse
Direct Known Subclasses:
EE7JDBCAccessLogFilter.EE7FilterResponse, FacadeJDBCAccessLogFilter.FacadeFilterResponse, JDBCAccessLogValve.ValveFilterResponse
Enclosing class:
JDBCAccessLogFilter
public class JDBCAccessLogFilter.FilterResponse
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponseWrapper

Wrapper to allow getting values that are only supported in later environments or are not exposed by the standard interface. The names of the implementation functions differ from the names of the potential functions of the interfaces because their contracts differ.

Field Summary
protected  javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext
          Cached ServletContext obtained from FilterConfig for Filters but computed for Valves, which may service several contexts.

Field Detail

servletContext

protected javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext
Cached ServletContext obtained from FilterConfig for Filters but computed for Valves, which may service several contexts.

Constructor Detail

JDBCAccessLogFilter.FilterResponse

protected JDBCAccessLogFilter.FilterResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpResponse)
Constructor wraps response of HTTP query, saves the current time near the beginning of the query, and uses reflection to identify unadvertised methods if a Filter flag requests it.

Method Detail

getCount

protected java.lang.Long getCount()
                           throws javax.servlet.ServletException
If available, return a count of bytes that were sent, which is typically only available in Valves, not the standard interface. Replaces a non-positive value with null.

Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException - If reflection fails to notice that a proposed Method is actually unavailable or on an unexpected reflected return type.

getLongLength

protected java.lang.Long getLongLength()
                                throws javax.servlet.ServletException
If available, return an estimate of bytes that were to be sent, typically as calculated for a Content-Length output header. Replaces a non-positive value with null.

Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException - If reflection fails to notice that a proposed Method is actually unavailable or on an unexpected reflected return type.

getStatusInteger

protected java.lang.Integer getStatusInteger()
                                      throws javax.servlet.ServletException
If available, return the 3-digit status code of the response. The earlier HttpServletResponse interface omitted this important value, which was available to Valves. Replaces a non-positive value with null.

Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException - If reflection fails to notice that a proposed Method is actually unavailable or on an unexpected reflected return type.

getStringHeader

protected java.lang.String getStringHeader(java.lang.String name)
                                    throws javax.servlet.ServletException
If available, return the first value assigned to a header in the response. The earlier HttpServletResponse interface omitted this important capability, which was available to Valves.

Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException - If reflection fails to notice that a proposed Method is actually unavailable.

If available, return all values assigned with the same header name in the response. The earlier HttpServletResponse interface omitted this important capability, which was available to Valves.

getStringHeaderNames

protected java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getStringHeaderNames()
                                                               throws javax.servlet.ServletException
If available, return all header names used in the response. The earlier HttpServletResponse interface omitted this important capability, which was available to Valves.

Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException - If reflection fails to notice that a proposed Method is actually unavailable.

getCurrentTimeMillis

protected long getCurrentTimeMillis()
Since Timestamps are rounded in serveral database implementations, provide the time in milliseconds that the host JVM supports. This time estimate might be used as a database primary key, which could be incremented if a collision were detected, without substantially effecting the usefulness of the estimate.

setThrowable

public void setThrowable(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Set Throwable thrown during processing.

Parameters:
throwable - Anything throw, during processing.

getThrowable

public java.lang.Throwable getThrowable(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
Get anything thrown thrown during processing including from request attributes set on error pages. If nothing thrown, returns null.

getFilter

protected JDBCAccessLogFilter getFilter()
Return the Filter implementation so that Valves may access the parameters associated with the current response. A Valve may have several concurrent Filters, each with separate ServletContexts.

getServletContext

protected javax.servlet.ServletContext getServletContext()
If FilterConfig had a ServletContext while being called as a Filter, then the ServletContext is unique; otherwise null. When called as a Valve with potentially more than one container, then each container can have its own ServletContext, which FilterResponse discovers for each HTTP query.

log

protected void log(java.lang.CharSequence message)
Log message through a ServletContext associated with an HTTP request or response because Valves do not automatically has a ServletContext.

Parameters:
message - A CharSequence, which may not be null or empty, and which provides warning-level message about a continuable situation.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If the message parameter is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the message parameter is empty.

log

protected void log(java.lang.CharSequence message,
                   java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Log message with a throwable through a ServletContext associated with an HTTP request or response because Valves do not automatically has a ServletContext.

Parameters:
message - A CharSequence, which might be null or empty, to introduce the warning message.
throwable - Any Throwable, which will have its stack trace dumped, providing more information about a continuable situation.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If the throwable parameter is null.

stringArrayElement

protected void stringArrayElement(java.lang.String s,
                                  java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
Convert an element of a String array into a format that SqlStringArray may pass to the database. Each database vendor may have a different approach to quoting. PostgreSQL may use this version. Using java.lang.StringBuffer in order to use java.util.regex.Matcher.appendReplacement() and java.util.regex.Matcher.appendTail() pair with earlier Java versions that did not support java.lang.StringBuilder, which does not do unneeded sychronization.

Parameters:
s - A String element of an array or collection that will be quoted for use with SqlStringArray.
sb - A StringBuffer that will compose the quoted element into an array literal for PreparedStatement.setArray(int, java.sql.Array) or PreparedStatement.setClob(int, String).

createArray

protected java.sql.Array createArray(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                     java.lang.String stringElementSqlType,
                                     java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> collection)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                     java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                     java.sql.SQLException
Throws:
